headline: Artificial Intelligence (AI) Is Set to Drive Sizzling Growth in This Market: Here's 1 Stock That Could Win Big From This Emerging Opportunity
summary: The proliferation of artificial intelligence (AI) is having a positive effect on multiple industries, and cloud computing is one of the markets where the adoption of this technology is helping companies mint a lot of money.  From hardware suppliers such as Nvidia, whose chips are being used by cloud service providers (CSPs) to train AI models, to Oracle, whose infrastructure is being rented by companies to train models and deploy AI applications, several tech companies have seen a nice lift in their revenue because of this technology.  According to market research provider Market.us, the adoption of AI in the observability space is set to increase at a compound annual rate of 22.5% through 2033, generating close to $11 billion in revenue at the end of the forecast period.

headline: Datadog raises annual forecast betting on AI-driven cybersecurity demand
summary: Datadog raised its full-year revenue to be about $2.66 billion, compared to its earlier expectation of between $2.62 billion and $2.63 billion.  An increasing number of Datadog customers are deploying their artificial intelligence apps in live production, which is expected to boost usage of the company's products.  AI apps run in the cloud, and a large-scale migration to the cloud is anticipated, boding well for companies such as Datadog, which provide monitoring software for cloud infrastructure.

headline: Datadog Earnings Beat, Billings Miss With Revenue Guidance In-Line

headline: Datadog (DDOG) Beats Q3 Earnings and Revenue Estimates

headline: Datadog Earnings Beat Expectations. Why the Stock Is Falling Anyway.
summary: Datadog reported better-than-expected profit and revenue in the third quarter, but the software company’s stock fell as its guidance didn’t appeal to investors.  New-York based Datadog, which helps clients detect and analyze malicious activity in real time, posted adjusted earnings of 46 cents a share for the three months through September, Thursday morning.  Quarterly revenue grew by 26% from a year earlier to $690 million, while the consensus call was for $665 million.
